page.title: 05ASHBROOK HOUSE, CLYRO
page.content: Today {Ashbrook House,}is a family residence. On the East facing Wall is a large, arched window overlooking the hall and the stairs. The window was probably built into the house following its removal from {St. {Michael's Church}during rennovation during the last century. The House is of four stories and presents an imposing presence in the village centre. The name of the house is obviously derived from Clyro Brook which runs beneath the west lawn and the Ash Tree which stands in the East Garden. The House is now one of many { {listed buildings }which make up the traditional core of the present village.
